Yesterday I was asked to create a user account and use a known vuln bounty platform (BBP) to report a vuln in a 3rd party vendor. Today the BBP tells me that they don't have the hardware to test the reported vuln and asked for more details, tools, etc. (thread... )

Why I've to create an account in a bugbounty platform for reporting a vulnerability affecting a 3rd party vendor? I just need an easy way to report not wasting time and not following specific procedures "Law 3: Your rules and procedures are not important" https://t.co/Q3jbANLYGx

10 Laws of Disclosure 
1: Vuln finder is always right
2: Have an easy way to report vulns
3: Your rules are not important
4: Keep vuln finder up to date
5: Don’t play dirty
6: Compensate
7: Forget NDAs and threats
8: Put the right people in place
9: Coordinate
10: Always publish

New blog post: "10 Laws of Disclosure"
If you build technology you should find them very useful
